you can get back to a default config with sudo dpkg-reconfigure -pcritical xserver-xorg , it'll make a backup and you can compare
no, just replace nv with nvidia in xorg.conf . Compare the files to see the driver config
you won't need to worry about the actual nvidia driver installation until you get a new kernel
if you have any fears, just   cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf ~/Desktop , you'll have your original xorg.conf safely on your desktop
